data.description:
Update beads dep show command to display close/open status using circle symbols instead of text status labels.

Current behavior:
- Shows status as text: [open], [closed], [in_progress]
- Header: Dependencies for bd-041 - Filter closed dependencies from blocker display
- Blockers: ↳ bd-025 [closed] p2 - Implement beads dep command...
- Dependents: ↳ bd-043 [open] p1 - Some other issue
- Does NOT show status of main issue (bd-041) in the header

Desired behavior:
- Use status indicators: ○ for open/in_progress, ● for closed
- Header: Dependencies for ○ bd-041 - Filter closed dependencies from blocker display
- Blockers: ↳ ● bd-025 p2 - Implement beads dep command...
- Dependents: ↳ ○ bd-043 p1 - Some other issue
- Show status circle of main issue in the header

Implementation details:
- Extract status_indicator function from list.rs to shared module or keep in both files
- Update line: println!("Dependencies for {} - {}", issue.id, issue.title);
  To: println!("Dependencies for {} {} - {}", status_indicator(&issue.status), issue.id, issue.title);
- Update blocker display: remove [status] text, replace with circle
- Update dependent display: remove [status] text, replace with circle
- Note: get_open_dependencies() already filters, but all should display status circles regardless

data.architecture: Blob Store (.beads/blobs/): Permanent and immutable, checked into Git. Working Directory (.beads/docs/): Temporary and ignored, added to .gitignore. Uses content-addressable storage with SHA-256 hashing.
data.commands: beads doc add <id> <file>: Adds new document from external file. beads doc edit <id> <doc_name>: Exports document to workspace for editing. beads doc sync <id> [doc_name]: Checks in changes from workspace to blob store. beads doc list <id>: Lists all documents attached to issue.
data.description: Implement an immutable blob store for document attachments with ephemeral workspace. The blob store (.beads/blobs/) will be permanent and immutable, serving as the source of truth for all content history and checked into Git. The working directory (.beads/docs/) will be temporary and ignored, treated as a disposable workspace that users check out documents to, edit, and check back in.
data.title: Implement blob storage system for issue documents
data.workflows: 1) Create issue with documents: beads create --doc name:path. 2) Edit-Sync loop: beads doc edit <id> <doc> exports to workspace, beads doc sync <id> <doc> checks in changes. 3) Add new document: beads doc add <id> <file>.

data.description: Update init_repo function to create the .beads/blobs directory for blob storage and update .gitignore to exclude both .beads/beads.db and .beads/docs/
data.rationale: The blob store must be created at repo initialization. The docs workspace must be gitignored to prevent accidental commits of temporary user edits. Only blob store and events.jsonl should be committed.
tasks: Update ensure_gitignore_has_db to add .beads/docs/ entry to prevent committing temporary workspace files
data.technical_details: Add BLOBS_DIR constant. Create directory alongside other .beads subdirs. Modify ensure_gitignore_has_db to handle multiple entries with proper formatting.
data.title: Update repo initialization for blob store and docs workspace

data.considerations: Blobs are immutable - never overwrite. Same content = same hash = deduplication. No blob deletion for now (can add garbage collection later).
data.description: Create new blob storage module implementing content-addressable storage using SHA-256 hashing. Provides write_blob to store content and read_blob to retrieve it by hash.
data.error_handling: Return meaningful errors for: blob not found, I/O errors, invalid hash format. Consider adding hash validation on read.
functions: write_blob(repo: &BeadsRepo, content: &[u8]) -> Result<String>: Calculates SHA-256 hash of content, writes to .beads/blobs/<hash>, returns hash string
read_blob(repo: &BeadsRepo, hash: &str) -> Result<Vec<u8>>: Reads content from .beads/blobs/<hash>, returns content bytes
data.implementation_details: Use sha2 crate for hashing. Hash format: lowercase hex string. Blob files stored as .beads/blobs/<full-hash> with no extension. Handle file I/O errors gracefully. Ensure directory exists before writing.
data.title: Implement blob store module with write_blob and read_blob functions

data.data_structure: Documents stored in issue data field as: {"documents": {"api-spec.md": "<hash>", "notes.txt": "<hash>"}}. Each document update creates new blob with new hash.
data.description: Modify core issue creation and management functions to support document attachments stored in blob store. Documents are stored in issue data field as a map of doc_name -> hash.
data.event_semantics: Create event includes initial documents. Update events modify documents map. Hash changes = content changes. Document history tracked through event log.
functions_to_modify: create_issue_with_data: Add docs: Vec<(String, String)> parameter for (doc_name, content) tuples. Process into blobs and add documents map to data JSON
data.integration: Use blob::write_blob and blob::read_blob. Parse/serialize documents map in data JSON. Validate doc_name uniqueness per issue.
new_functions: add_document_to_issue(repo: &BeadsRepo, issue_id: &str, doc_name: &str, content: &str) -> Result<()>: Creates blob, issues Update event to add/update document in documents map
get_issue_documents(repo: &BeadsRepo, issue_id: &str) -> Result<HashMap<String, String>>: Fetches issue from DB, parses documents map from data field, returns doc_name -> hash mapping
data.title: Update core logic to support document attachments in issues

data.create_command_updates: Add --doc <DOC_NAME:FILE_PATH> argument to beads create, allow multiple uses. In commands/create.rs: parse doc arguments with name:path format, read file contents, pass (name, content) tuples to create_issue_with_data. Example: beads create --title ... --data {} --doc api-spec:./specs/api.md --doc notes:./notes.txt
data.description: Add beads doc subcommand with add/edit/sync/list operations for document management. Add --doc flag to beads create for attaching documents at creation time.
data.doc_add: beads doc add <issue_id> <file_path>: Reads external file, calls add_document_to_issue with file basename as doc_name. Prints confirmation. Does NOT copy to workspace.
data.doc_edit: beads doc edit <issue_id> <doc_name>: Looks up hash from DB, reads blob content, ensures .beads/docs/<issue_id>/ exists, writes to .beads/docs/<issue_id>/<doc_name>. Prints export path for user/agent to edit.
data.doc_list: beads doc list <issue_id>: Calls get_issue_documents, prints table of doc_name and first 8 chars of hash for each document.
data.doc_subcommand: Create commands/doc.rs with subcommands: add, edit, sync, list. Each operates on issue documents through blob store.
data.doc_sync: beads doc sync <issue_id> <doc_name>: Reads .beads/docs/<issue_id>/<doc_name>, calculates hash, compares to DB version. If different: writes new blob, creates Update event with new hash. Optionally delete temp file after sync.
data.title: Implement beads doc CLI subcommand and --doc flag for create
data.ux_considerations: Clear messages for each operation. Handle missing files, invalid issue IDs. Confirm sync operations. Show helpful next steps (after edit, suggest sync).
